Name: Email Blast
Purpose: Determine if Special Perks affect retention when bundled and provided to a Spot Customer
Setup: Email blast to customers who enrolled between November & December and who were still active at time of blast
Variant(s): Recieved an email notifying them of Spot perks (multi-perk email)
Results:
* Control Group: 19,360, Total Cancels: 860, Cancel Rate: 4.44%
* Test Group: 19,134, Total Cancels: 759, Cancel Rate: 3.97%
Lift: Statistically significant 11% decrease in churn for perk blast group, repull on 1/6/2025 found still significant 2.94% reduction in cancellations

Name: Golden Day 12
Purpose: Determine if Special Perks affect retention when bundled or isolated and provided to a Spot customer.
Setup: Sample of people who purchased over a 2 week period, given either normal Golden Journey 12-day email or one with perks
Control: Received normal Day 12 Golden Journey Email
Variant(s): Received Day 12 email with perks, either multi-perk or single Koala perk
Results:
* Control Group: 8047, Total Cancels: 802, Cancel Rate: 9.97%
* Test Group: 7,903, Total Cancels: 745, Cancel rate: 9.43%
Lift: Not significant, 5.4% improvement in cancel rate

Name: March Exclusive Perk in QF
Purpose: Determine if Exclusive Perks affect retention and acquisition when isolated and provided to a Spot customer.
Setup: Dog owners in 4 test states (NJ, IN, AZ, CA) saw exclusive Simparica offer
Control: All cat owners, and dog owners not in test states
Results: Significant 4.0 QTP lift for 77% of test-state quoters
Lift: If we assume dog and cat owners are equally swayed by perks, the implied lift is 5.3%

Name: Social Influencer
Purpose: To determine whether having an influencer plug spot perks improves any key metrics
Setup: A sponsored TikTok influencer post w/o perks at first, and then a sponsored post w/ perks a month later
Results:
* Control Group:
  * CPL: $27.61
  * CPP: $496
  * UTQ: 11.82%
  * QTP: 5%
  * Clicks: 2,859
  * Total spend: $9,020
* Test Group:
  * CPL: $20.48 
  * CPP: $308 
  * UTQ: 13.7%
  * QTP: 6.7%
  * clicks: 6,459
  * Total spend: $18,223
Lift:
* 26% lower CPL
  * 38% lower CPP
  * UTQ:  +16%
  * QTP: +34%
  * Clicks: +126%
  * Spend: +102%

Name: Special 6-perk QF (Standard)
Purpose: To determine the effect of having multiple perks in the QF
Hypothesis: We think that by offering more perks from established brands, QTP will go up due to the perceived added value to the customer
Setup:
2 different variants, one with 6 special dog perks, and one with 6 special cat perks. 

Dog Perks: Ancestry

* 20$ Off a Pet DNA Kit
* Learn more about your pet with a test kit brought to you by the DNA experts at Ancestry®

Farmer's Dog

* 60% Off Dog Food from Farmer's Dog
* Get 60% off your first box of real, fresh food from The Farmer's Dog

Bark

* Free Month of Bark Subscription
* Subscription of pet toys from Bark Box or Super Chewer

Rover

* $20 Off Pet Sitting
* Rover is the #1 pet sitting and dog walking app.

Koala

* 45% Off Pet Meds
* Koala Health offers pet prescriptions to help keep your pet healthy.

DogTV

* 35% Off DogTV Annual Subscription
* 24/7 channel, designed to alleviate your pup’s stress and anxiety throughout the day.

Cats:

Basepaws

* 20% Off Pet DNA Kit
* Discover your pet’s genetic blueprint with a Basepaws DNA kit.

Smalls

* 20% Off for the First Three Orders
* Smalls is made fresh with human grade ingredients and sent straight to you.

Petivity

* 20% Off Microbiome Analysis Kit
* Petivity Analysis Kits are designed to unlock valuable information about your pet’s health.

Meowtel

* $25 Off Cat Sitting
* Meowtel is the #1 Cat Sitting app. Book a trusted & local cat sitter.

Petlibro

* 40% Off Petlibro Space Feeder
* 2-in-1 food storage and smart feeder with vacuum-seal for freshness.

Furbo

* Up to $55 Off Furbo Pet Cam
* Always be together. See, talk and toss treats to your pet from anywhere.
Results: Horizontal Cards was the winner across all states and species. 3% Improvement on exclusive perk, 14% significant improvement on no perk states
Lift: 3% Improvement on exclusive perk, 14% significant improvement on no perk states

Name: 6-perk Core Offering Alignment
Purpose: To see whether Perks perform better as a clearly separate entity, or formatted to look more like a core offering of our insurance product
Setup: Same 6 perk setup as standard test, but this time with the perks designed to look like our “what’s covered” section
Results: Performed worse than standard 6-perk horizontal card

Name: Lapsed Perks Test
Purpose: To test whether putting perks in the lapsed journey can decrease the amount of CX due to lapses we have
Hypothesis: If we explicitly call attention to the perks provided by Spot, then more people will feel the urgency to re-up their payment info
Setup: Push 2 different perks creatives to 33% of lapsed journeys, respectively
Variant(s):
1. All emails in lapsed journey have a perks creative in them
2. All emails have perks creative, but one of the first emails contains copy such as: “Renew your payment info and retain access to exclusive discount codes included with your plan!”

Name: Multi-Cohort Perk Retention Test
Purpose: To further investigate the effect perks have on retention rate
Hypothesis: If we push perks to a sample of our entire book, then we will be able to see whether time has an effect on perk-induced retention
Setup:
Push a multi perk email to 8 different cohorts:

* 30 Days
* 90 Days
* 6 months
* 9 months
* 1 year
* 18 months
* 2 years
* >2 years
Control: 80% of book stays in normal golden journey
Variant(s): 20% of each cohort to receive perks email
Results: cancel rate dropped for the 3-6 month cohort by 8%
